newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines says invites tenders for 150,000T corn.
newsitem.headline: Philippines says invites tenders for 150,000T corn.

text.p: The Philippine state National Food Authority (NFA) said on Friday it would tender for 150,000 tonnes of U.S. yellow corn No 2 or its equivalent on October 29.
"We have advised traders that we are looking for U.S. yellow corn number 2, with shipments originating either from the U.S. Pacific Northwest, Gulf or Argentina," an NFA official told Reuters.
Philippine traders said they have been informed that the NFA wants the shipment to arrive in December.
Livestock raisers, however, said 150,000 tonnes is not enough to meet their requirements up to the first quarter of 1997.

Philippine Association of Hog Raisers Inc president Soledad Agbayani told reporters feed millers, hog and poultry raisers have asked the Department of Agriculture to import an additional 250,000 tonnes of corn.
This will help make up for shortfalls in local supply between the last quarter of this year up and March 1997.
Since the start of the year, the Philippines has imported 250,000 tonnes of corn for animal feed, all of it from the United States and Argentina.
